if your not using any special nameserver, just try and stick the line nameserver 8.8.8.8 in the /etc/resolv.conf file
it should work instantly once saved
that looks like your router or gateway, which is not correct for a nameserver usually, try 8.8.8.8 which is the google dns server

You might want to check it sticks around after a reboot, ubuntu has tools these days which can automatically overwrite this file. I think there is a connection manager application manager somewhere that you can set this in, if it doesn't survive the reboot.
